intro: Tupistra tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring small, simple leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
